001package gbw.melange.common.mesh;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Mesh;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable;
005import gbw.melange.common.mesh.modifiers.MeshModifier;
006import gbw.melange.common.mesh.errors.MeshProcessingIssue;
007
008import java.util.List;
009
010/**
011 * Represents a mesh, albeit with a focus on processing and modification rather than memory and performance.
012 * Additionally, facilitates processing the mesh in parallel while still using the earlier copy.
013 * Has the same caching mechanisms as the managed shaders so the performance during runtime is almost as good as a plain {@link Mesh}. <br/>
014 * Comes in 2 flavours: Modifiable (datatable retained) and unmodifiable (datatable dropped), which can be checked using {@link IManagedMesh#isModifiable()}
015 */
016public interface IManagedMesh extends Disposable {
017    /**
018     * Convert the current data to a mesh using the derived or default vertex attribute ordering.
019     */
020    Mesh getMesh();
021
022    /**
023     * Check if a data table is available to run the modifiers on.
024     */
025    boolean isModifiable();
026    void addModifier(MeshModifier modifier);
027    void addModifiers(List<MeshModifier> modifiers);
028    List<MeshModifier> getModifiers();
029
030    /**
031     * Apply any current modifiers registered to the mesh in the order of registration, and store the resulting mesh for further use. <br/>
032     * If this is a one time thing, consider dropping the current vertex data table to use less memory. <br/>
033     * If you choose to drop the underlying datatable, no further modifications can be done to this mesh
034     * and a {@link gbw.melange.common.mesh.errors.UnmodifiableMeshIssue} will be thrown if attempted. </br>
035     * You can also choose to keep the modified data table. This is an exclusive option, and void if you also choose to drop it.
036     * @param dropDataTable yes / no, default = no
037     * @param modifyDataTable yes / no, default = no
038     */
039    void applyModifiers(boolean dropDataTable, boolean modifyDataTable) throws MeshProcessingIssue;
040
041    /**
042     * Clear the current modifier list.
043     */
044    void clearModifiers();
045
046    /**
047     * Apply the modifiers of this mesh, but store the result as a new instance which is then returned as the result. <br/>
048     * You can choose to either copy as unmodifiable by not including a copy of the data table in the copy as well.
049     * @param copyDataTable yes/no, default = yes.
050     */
051    IManagedMesh copyAndApply(boolean copyDataTable) throws MeshProcessingIssue;
052
053}
